cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend tonight, then sweep across south Georgia into coastal South Carolina and emerge offshore toward the mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near the Suwannee River–Mexico Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet, including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC (includes entire Georgia and South Carolina coasts)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through Georgia and South Carolina coasts northward into North Carolina and the mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph gusts) likely Friday afternoon through late Friday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the South Carolina coast, including Charleston Harbor, especially at high tide Friday night.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated totals near 10 inches, creating flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Friday into Friday night across eastern South Carolina.
